sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 3, 5} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product A x B and B x A. Then, find the symmetric difference of A x B and B x A. Show that the symmetric difference of the two sets is not commutative.
